name: Los Alamos
description: A pivotal scientific community where the atomic bomb was developed in the story.

content.title: History
content.body: Founded during World War II as part of the Manhattan Project, Los Alamos was established to develop the atomic bomb. It housed many of the brightest scientists and served as a secretive and highly secure military location.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Situated in a remote desert in the fictional universe, Los Alamos was carefully chosen for its isolation, making it an ideal location for secretive military research.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
Key landmarks include:
- **The Laboratory Buildings**: Where scientists worked tirelessly on the Manhattan Project.
- **The Housing Facility**: Home to Oppenheimer and other important characters during the project.
- **The Testing Grounds**: Nearby fields where initial testing of prototypes occurred.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Los Alamos is the epicenter of the Manhattan Project in the story, where J. Robert Oppenheimer and his team worked on developing the atomic bomb. It serves as a backdrop for significant plot developments and character interactions.
